articles.author: Mathew Di Salvo
articles.description: The “Oracle of Omaha” made up his mind about crypto long ago, it seems.
articles.title: Warren Buffett Blasts Bitcoin as 'Gambling Token' as BTC Surges 35% in 30 Days

articles.author: Sander Lutz
articles.description: At a Beverly Hills gala hosted by street artist Mr. Brainwash, social media influencers pondered the future—and the place for Web3 in it.
articles.title: Mr. Brainwash, 100 Influencers, and Web3 Walk Into a Museum

articles.author: Kate Irwin
articles.description: For the next month, the hunt is on for virtual music amidst dead-end viruses.
articles.title: LimeWire Launches Nostalgic Music Downloading Game With Crypto Rewards

articles.author: Alyssa Hertig
articles.description: Analytics companies make a living tracking Bitcoin transactions. Developer Dan Gould wants to make their lives harder with PayJoins.
articles.title: Bitcoin Privacy Tool Aims to 'Confuse' Surveillance Companies

articles.author: Jose Antonio Lanz
articles.description: A new, uncensored open-source large language model is being used by the AI community to build X-rated chatbots, because of course it is.
articles.title: AI Sex Chatbots and the Dudes Who Love Them

articles.author: Liam J. Kelly,Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: On-chain analysis from Glassnode estimates that roughly 170,000 ETH will be withdrawn and sold after the Shanghai upgrade.
articles.title: More Than $300 Million in Ethereum Will Be Sold After Shanghai, Analysts Say

articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: The $15 NFT is billed as “your ticket to the House of Lee” and was created in collaboration with the Bruce Lee Estate.
articles.title: Bruce Lee Enters Web3, Starting With Open Edition NFT From Pplpleasr

articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: Brown and other characters from the smash South Korean franchise will cross paths with Azuki’s Beanz NFT characters.
articles.title: Azuki NFT Creator Chiru Labs Reveals Collab With Line Friends

articles.author: André Beganski
articles.description: Bitcoin rose slightly after fresh inflation data hinted at a possible path forward for future rate hikes from the Fed.
articles.title: Bitcoin Edges Higher as Inflation Cools More Than Expected in March

articles.author: Ryan Gladwin
articles.description: After three previous delays, Bitcoin miner Bitdeer now expects to finally start trading on the Nasdaq on April 14.
articles.title: Bitcoin Miner Bitdeer Expected to Finally Go Public This Friday

articles.author: Nivesh Rustgi
articles.description: Ren community members say they were prepared for this event, having warned users to withdraw and redeem their remaining assets.
articles.title: Alameda-linked Ren Protocol Transfers $13M in Bitcoin to FTX Debtors

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: Three weeks after the SEC accused Justin Sun of manipulating the price of TRX, Binance US said it will delist the asset.
articles.title: Binance US to Delist Justin Sun's Tron Token Next Week

articles.author: Alyssa Hertig
articles.description: The former head of PayPal and co-creator of Diem announces a new open payment protocol.
articles.title: David Marcus's Lightspark Unveils Bitcoin Lightning Platform for Business

articles.author: Mathew Di Salvo
articles.description: Over 53% of coins ever minted haven’t budged for more than two years, new data shows.
articles.title: More Bitcoin Than Ever Is Now ‘Dormant’—Here’s What That Means

articles.author: André Beganski
articles.description: The a16z investment firm warns that the rapid rise in regulatory actions are a threat to American innovation.
articles.title: The U.S. Is Losing Its Edge in Crypto, Says Andreessen Horowitz

articles.author: Mathew Di Salvo
articles.description: Registered broker Rashawn Russell was arrested in New York yesterday for promising altcoin riches.
articles.title: Ex-JP Morgan and Deutsche Bank Employee Charged With Crypto Fraud

articles.author: Tom Farren
articles.description: After minting more than 10.6 million Polygon NFTs, Reddit is launching a huge Gen 3 collection today. Artists tell Decrypt what to expect.
articles.title: Reddit Just Dropped Thousands More NFTs on Polygon From Over 100 Artists

articles.author: Kate Irwin
articles.description: The major hardware and peripherals brand is funding Web3 games through a new Web3 incubator within its venture arm.
articles.title: Gaming Hardware Giant Razer Launches Web3 Incubator

articles.author: Liam J. Kelly
articles.description: Since volumes for borrowing against NFTs crossed the $1 billion mark, many are left wondering: Who’s using their jpeg as collateral in this market?
articles.title: Borrowing Against NFTs Is Now a $1 Billion Industry—What’s Next?

articles.author: Ryan Gladwin
articles.description: Another address has been blacklisted by stablecoin provider Tether, bringing its total of banned addresses to 865.
articles.title: ‘Sandwich the Ripper’ MEV Exploiter Joins Tether’s Graveyard of Blacklisted Addresses

articles.author: Tim Hakki
articles.description: CleanSpark's $144.9 million deal with Bitmain will double its fleet's total operational mining capacity by the end of the year.
articles.title: CleanSpark Doubles Bitcoin Mining Fleet With $145M Deal

articles.author: Ekin Genç
articles.description: Proof-of-stake networks like Ethereum will reward you with crypto for staking your coins. Here’s how that works.
articles.title: How Do You Stake Cryptocurrencies? Earning Passive Income With Crypto

articles.author: Alys Key
articles.description: The European Union will soon usher in a suite of new crypto rules called MiCA. But what are they and what does it mean for the industry?
articles.title: MiCA: What Europe’s New Crypto Rules Mean for the Industry

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: As the price of Bitcoin recaptures $30,000, MicroStrategy's bold investment in the largest cryptocurrency appears to be paying off.
articles.title: MicroStrategy's Bitcoin Bet Now in Profit Amid Latest Rally

articles.author: Nivesh Rustgi
articles.description: SOL is riding the positive sentiment across the crypto market and the excitement around its Android phone launch.
articles.title: Solana Leads Crypto Market Rebound, Jumps 10% Overnight

articles.author: Sander Lutz
articles.description: The collection will feature 10,000 pieces from 22 artists, including Beeple.
articles.title: Proof Launches Exclusive NFT Collection for Moonbirds Holders

articles.author: Mathew Di Salvo
articles.description: Bitcoin is surging—up 9% in the last week—and the crypto market is following suit.
articles.title: Bitcoin Hits $30,000, Reaching 10-Month High

articles.author: André Beganski
articles.description: The two potential candidates in the 2024 election have criticized central bank digital currencies as tools for financial surveillance.
articles.title: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. Joins Ron DeSantis in Railing Against CBDCs

articles.author: Sander Lutz
articles.description: The feature-length film, produced by PleasrDAO and Own the Doge, hopes to attract a major Hollywood studio or backer.
articles.title: 'Dogumentary' Film to Chronicle Rise of Meme That Inspired Dogecoin

articles.author: Jose Antonio Lanz
articles.description: ...or teeth, or toes, or abs. Yet.
articles.title: AI Kryptonite: Why Artificial Intelligence Can't Handle Hands

articles.author: Stacy Elliott
articles.description: FTX “kept virtually all crypto assets in hot wallets," CEO John Ray III, who's overseeing the company's restructuring, wrote in a report.
articles.title: FTX CEO Slams Exchange for Keeping Private Keys on Amazon Web Services

articles.author: Tom Farren
articles.description: More than 18 million ETH—worth roughly $34 billion—is set to unlock after Shanghai. Here's what analysts are expecting.
articles.title: How the Ethereum Shanghai Upgrade Could Impact the Price of ETH

articles.description: Coinbase Chief Legal Officer Paul Grewal discussed the "Howey Test," which the SEC uses as its yard stick for whether a crypto asset should be regulated as a security, and told Decrypt's Stacy Elliott and Dan Roberts the issue with it isn't that it's old (the case is from 1946) but how it's being applied to modern technology. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: Coinbase Chief Legal Officer: The Problem With SEC's Howey Test Isn't Its Age

articles.author: Daniel Roberts
articles.description: Gary Gensler's SEC won't roll out new rules for crypto because the agency believes the Howey Test is perfectly sufficient for assessing tokens.
articles.title: Every Crypto Project Must Reckon With the SEC's Howey Test

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: South Korean cryptocurrency exchange GDAC has reported it lost nearly a quarter of its assets due to a hacking attack.
articles.title: Hackers Rob South Korean Exchange of $13M in Bitcoin, Ethereum, Other Assets

articles.author: Nivesh Rustgi
articles.description: The latest update on the FTX estate reveals a series of “unusual obstacles” due to the firm’s lack of “appropriate record keeping.”
articles.title: FTX Debtors Say 'Hubris, Incompetence, and Greed' at Root of Exchange's Collapse

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: Should it pass, the bill states that discrimination against crypto mining businesses would be prohibited in Arkansas.
articles.title: Bitcoin Miners Will Have Same Rights as Data Centers, Says New Arkansas Bill

articles.author: André Beganski
articles.description: Although it gets a lot of negative attention, Bitcoin’s power usage also creates accountability, says Jaime Leverton.
articles.title: Bitcoin’s Energy Transparency Is a Double-Edged Sword: Hut 8 Mining CEO

articles.author: Ryan Ozawa
articles.description: The decentralized exchange says it's "all hands on deck" and that some of the funds have been recovered.
articles.title: SushiSwap Smart Contract Bug Exploited in $3.3 Million Theft

articles.author: Tim Hakki
articles.description: CoinFLEX co-founder Mark Lamb tweeted a bizarre letter to his alleged debtors and a candidate for U.S. president 2024 spread serious misinformation.
articles.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Musk Goes Full Dogecoin, Pumping the Memecoin

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: The new upload feature takes the guesswork out of the creative art process.
articles.title: Midjourney Uses Photo Uploads To Help You Craft Prompts

articles.description: Leo Matchett from Web3 film funding platform Decentralized Pictures tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson at Outer Edge LA about DCP's just announced iPhone Filmmaking Initiative, which will support aspiring filmmakers who create a short film on their iPhones, and will be determined via DCP's crypto-native on-chain voting system.
articles.title: Decentralized Pictures Plots Its Next Web3 Grant for Filmmakers

articles.description: Web3 gaming YouTuber CryptoStache talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at Outer Edge LA about why Web3 gaming will bring NFTs mainstream, the partnerships that prove it's already happening, how gamers will change their tune on NFTs, and how the terminology is likely to change.
articles.title: Web3 YouTuber CryptoStache: Gaming Will Be the Catalyst That Takes NFTs Mainstream

articles.description: Steve H., VP of sales from Fordefi, which raised $18 million in funding last year, tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson at Outer Edge LA how Fordefi uses multi-party computation to make signing transactions on an institutional crypto wallet much simpler—no seed phrase needed.
articles.title: Fordefi Aims to Dramatically Simplify the Institutional Crypto Wallet

articles.description: Toronto-based Bitcoin mining company Hut 8 recently announced a merger with U.S. Bitcoin Corp that will take it into Texas, Nebraska, and New York. Hut 8 CEO Jaime Leverton joined Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott to talk expanding into the U.S., dealing with regulatory pushback post-FTX, why Texas is such a hotspot, and where she'd like to expand globally down the road (the climates may surprise you). Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Canadian Bitcoin Miner Hut 8 Is Heading West

articles.description: Move over, DeFi—ReFi is coming? Gitcoin founder Kevin Owocki has stepped away from DeFi grant-giving machine Gitcoin as it fully decentralizes and is now focused on regenerative finance (huh?) and ReFi incubator Supermodular. He aims to "regenerate the regenerators." He explained it all to Dan Roberts and Liam Kelly, and also talks DAO structure, crypto factions, NFT use cases, his book "Greenpilled," and much more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Kevin Owocki Wants to Regenerate DeFi

articles.description: Aurory executive producer and head of production Jonathan Campeau tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC about how the first-generation of Web3 games came out of DeFi and are now evolving.
articles.title: Why Aurory's Head of Production Left Ubisoft for Web3

articles.description: With roughly 50 video games in its pipeline, Gala Games is all-in on Web3. Gala's President of Blockchain Jason Brink told Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC about the studio's ethos and weighs in on the different approaches to Web3 gaming.
articles.title: 'We Don't Really Do the Corporate Thing Very Well' Says Jason Brink on Gala Games Approach

articles.description: Paul Grewal is the Chief Legal Officer at Coinbase and a former U.S. magistrate judge in Northern California. He gave Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott his candid takes on Sam Bankman-Fried and FTX, the SEC's crackdown on staking, the sanctioning of Tornado Cash, and more alpha on how Coinbase is approaching the current unfriendly US regulatory environment. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Coinbase's Top Lawyer Gets Real on SEC

articles.description: Rotten Tomatoes founder Patrick Lee, who has led companies at the intersection of technology and entertainment from Web1 to Web3, spoke to Decrypt's Sander Lutz at Outer Edge LA about the current state of decentralized gaming, film and television.
articles.title: The Founder of Rotten Tomatoes Says Web3 Entertainment Isn’t Nearly Entertaining Enough Yet

articles.description: Gnosis first launched in 2015 as a decentralized prediction market built on Ethereum. Now it's a DAO, a multi-sig wallet, a staking chain, and a vibrant community with its own GNO governance token. Co-founder and COO Friederike Ernst talked to Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott about the careful evolution of Gnosis, decentralization impostors, account abstraction, DeFi UX failures, why Ethereum is the "Manhattan of crypto," and much more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: How Gnosis Has Endured and Evolved

articles.description: Justin Aversano, best known for his high-selling "Twin Flames" NFT photo series, joined Decrypt’s Andrew Hayward ahead of the upcoming L.A. exhibition for his new Ethereum NFT project "Smoke and Mirrors." He shared the wild inspiration behind the tarot-themed collection, and why—despite his growing profile—he opted not to exhibit at a major brand-name gallery.
articles.title: Justin Aversano's Inspiration for Tarot-Themed NFT Photo Series 'Smoke and Mirrors'

articles.description: Former "Call of Duty" developer Rob Bowling, now head of Midnight Society Studio, checked in with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC and shared some behind-the-scenes statistics on how players are enjoying "Deadrop." The game saw 90,000 player hours over the weekend, with 97 minutes average play time per player, and their community size tripled in just a few days.
articles.title: Midnight Society’s Rob Bowling Talks Deadrop Launch and Working With Dr. Disrespect

articles.description: On this panel from NFT Paris 2023 moderated by Decrypt's Dan Roberts, Web3 leads from some of the largest consumer and tech brands discuss their NFT strategies. Marc Mathieu of Salesforce, Tim Walther of VW Group, Eva Assayag of Panerai, and Samir Addamine of Absolute Labs joined the panel.
articles.title: Big Brands Get Serious About NFTs: Salesforce, VW, Panerai, Absolute Labs at NFT Paris

articles.description: At NFT Paris 2023, Decrypt’s Stephen Graves moderated a discussion about NFTs and the entertainment industry with Warner Bros’ NFT head Josh Hackbarth, CyberBrokers founder Josie Bellini, NFT Now founder Matt Medved and Dave Broome, CEO of Orange Comet, which has produced NFTs for Anthony Hopkins and The Walking Dead.
articles.title: NFT Entertainment Revolution: Warner Bros, Orange Comet, CyberBrokers and NFT Now at NFT Paris

articles.description: Knights Who Say Nah co-founder and project lead Nick Richey chats with Decrypt's Jason Nelson inside the group's armory of artifacts, shows off a historic Japanese tanto sword, and discusses why the preservation of historical artifacts is the best use case for NFTs.
articles.title: Step Inside the Armory of the NFT Collective 'Knights Who Say Nah'
